alert.note: Alert for Bourbon (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 31 at 3:09PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Kansas, including the following areas, Bourbon and Crawford. Portions of Missouri, including the following areas, Barton, Benton, Cedar, Hickory, St. Clair and Vernon. * WHEN...From 7 PM CDT this evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms looks to increase in coverage overnight. Two to three inches of rain will be possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
